text:
Is the future of surgery robotic? 

January’s issue of the Annals explores the use of technology and robotics in surgery, including the implications for trainees and the NHS. 

Read the full issue here: https://t.co/QGQvX6nrYW. https://t.co/xKd09ckPiV

Make it your #NewYear2022 resolution to certify your skills. Help us make aesthetic surgery safer by certifying under the Cosmetic Surgery Certification Scheme. Check your eligibility and start your application today: https://t.co/xqPMiz6blq https://t.co/fxAWrS6ibC

How important is nutrition to postoperative recovery? 

January's Bulletin looks at the impact of hospital food on patients, how MRCS exam performance relates to specialty choice and the costs and benefits of clinical travelling fellowships. 

Full issue:
https://t.co/18xWix55OG https://t.co/7ng2TInnCQ

#NewYear, new opportunities. There will be five vacancies to join our Council in 2022. This is your chance to represent your profession and the surgical community. More details to come when elections open on 5 January 2022. https://t.co/ISPfXzZKor

We're unwrapping 2021 to see what you loved the most! The newsletter story you read the most celebrated members on the Queen's Birthday Honours list: https://t.co/GJDMTjZFw7

Keep an eye out for the New Year's Honours in January. https://t.co/Rav2OsZpTz

@DrAphroditeENT We’re sorry that our choice of word in this tweet accidentally implied endorsement of the behaviour described in the article. Our series on unwrapping 2021 was intended to highlight our most popular content. Thank you for your feedback.

Despite 2021 being another year marked by the challenges of COVID-19, it has also been one of our most active. We opened the doors to our new home of surgery and published our diversity Action Plan. Thank you to our members, fellows, faculty and staff for another incredible year. https://t.co/LD2Xo9a0LQ

'Perfect for someone interested in breast surgery and/or undergoing a taster week... Amazing module!' Want to learn more about the modules on our PGCert in Surgery? Enrol in the full programme or select standalone modules to suit your career path: https://t.co/tpIgvU6joJ https://t.co/vMEeA3tfHJ

We're unwrapping 2021 to see what you loved the most! The most read Bulletin article this year was on sexual assault in surgery: https://t.co/JpgnLq78Xv

Which Bulletin article was your favourite this year? https://t.co/Dh0pYfOPDe

Not every patient looks the same. We need to use diverse real-life images in medical training to deliver the best patient care. Help us create a truly diverse online medical media library. Donate: https://t.co/FQ8PQ4c0Uz https://t.co/zeWDg0Xe9V

We're unwrapping 2021 to see what you loved most! The podcast episode you listened to most was on failing intelligently with @GinnyAB and @carisgrimes: https://t.co/6rZhDu3Lf5

Making plans for 2022? Why not prepare to spend a year training in research? Applications are open for our One-Year Surgical Research Fellowship. Theatre culture is underpinned by trust between surgeons and anaesthetists, guests say on our podcast. Listen to the discussion with @karenkchui, @deirdsconway, @scotgasdoc and @DrKariShah: https://t.co/WY4qZCOzb9 https://t.co/3OJ0XfxCqu

The ICBSE has released a statement and new FAQs on the 2022 MRCS exam timetable. From May 2022 we will be moving to a test centre approach, with centres available to candidates both in the UK and Ireland, and internationally. Find out more: https://t.co/j8e58LQOUM https://t.co/JlYiVNAl0O

Have you ever looked at images of surface anatomy and not recognised yourself? We are building a unique medical media library that will represent the full diversity of patients. Donate to our Winter Appeal: https://t.co/FQ8PQ4c0Uz https://t.co/AxnijOXY9r

Looking to get involved in research? Apply now for our exciting One-Year Surgical Research Fellowship. Open to trainee members who wish to study any aspect of surgery or surgical care, applications are open until 24 February 2022. https://t.co/laTg8JAJRz https://t.co/mt4B2lpK1U

We held a fantastic collaborative meeting with our CholeQuIC3 cohort last Friday. Our sites shared ideas on how to improve the quality of care for patients with acute gallstone disease. For more information and to #TryQI visit our website: https://t.co/xQsaNMkYSj https://t.co/sYLO1fpzYg

Santa may have an exemplary record, he surely has been checking his lists twice! Do not forget to join the Human Factors webinar tomorrow at 6pm. @medicmedicate Unfortunately this session is not being recorded. These sessions are a part of our Interview Skills Workshop

@medicmedicate @benchallacombe Hello @medicmedicate, this is for affiliate members who have signed up, but keep your eyes peeled for our interview skills webinar in the New Year - more details on this will be announced shortly!

"Make the most of your day and be the best you can!" Top tips from our #RCSinterviewskills Chair @DrFBE as she guides delegates preparing to interview core surgical training. https://t.co/ZCAQQYpdHp

We are delighted to welcome delegates onto our virtual interview skills workshop! We are kicking the day off with Elizabeth Sharp talking about the recruitment and interview process for CST. Keep an eye out for these key dates. #RCSinterviewskills https://t.co/g3WMZeCkH1

Our President @mortensen_neil joined the @medspirepodcast recently to discuss his career in colorectal surgery, advice for medical students and trainees, and his priorities for the College and the future of surgery. Listen here 🎧: https://t.co/oKoMs7Y1AZ

'No one refused to go into ITU, no one refused to treat a COVID patient... Hats off to our trainees, now is the time to give back to them' - @GinnyAB

Santa could be criticised for favouring one team member. Red nose or not, valuing all team members is vital. 
At our webinar on 14 December, 6pm, topics such as team work and hierarchy will be covered with Christmas cheer. 
Book your free place https://t.co/AiXDzQnesW https://t.co/MWJsD4k06w

The number of patients waiting for consultant-led hospital treatment has reached a record six million. Our Vice President, @TMitchellFRCS , has urged the government to publish its delayed Elective Recovery Plan, to help patients needing surgery: https://t.co/k7LVfkDyHS https://t.co/WJNzEjaAST

@NHSEngland are running a series of Pension Tax seminars as part of their Pensions Response Project. Consultants who are 50+ can find out more information about the Pensions Scheme and raise concerns. Find a date to suit you: https://t.co/Z0vYqQ4anI
Read further coverage from our NI director @markataylor16’s appearance at @niahealth in the @Independent: https://t.co/J9MDkLbXxT

Good to have presented our concerns to the Committee for Health @niassembly and that they agree urgent action is required to tackle the elective surgery backlog. In particular identifying surgical hubs to keep surgery going irrespective of Covid pressures and retaining nurses

Congratulations to @wesstreeting on his appointment as Shadow Health and Social Care Secretary. We look forward to working with you to tackle the elective backlog. Read our recommendations in our New Deal for Surgery report here https://t.co/5N4gf2Fgwy

If you have been practising cosmetic or aesthetic surgery for over three years, you could certify your skills as an Established Practitioner! Tune in to our webinar at 6pm tomorrow and hear how you can help to make the industry safer: https://t.co/rrjbzImtyh https://t.co/bT4F1vqzfq

‘Training any time, any place, every case - no excuses,’ the @JCST_Surgery document on COVID recovery has been endorsed by all four Royal Colleges. Everyone is part of the solution. #RCSEngRegionalReps https://t.co/SwwhYRgjMu

COVID has had a massive impact on trainees and trainers, as evidenced by #NoTrainingTodayNoSurgeonsTomorrow. Happy to hear from some of the leading voices in this crucial relationship this afternoon, starting with @JCST_Surgery Chair Jon Lund. #RCSEngRegionalReps https://t.co/DtoLBiRxAj
Important discussion happening at #RCSEngRegionalReps helping to shape our flagship project: Parents in Surgery. https://t.co/ALFmANYZ5m

RCS England Vice President Fiona Myint chairs our panel discussion on human factors. ‘HF integration into surgery needs to happen from the top down and the bottom up to meet somewhere in the middle and ensure we’re all on board,’ -@BrennanSurgeon #RCSEngRegionalReps https://t.co/RXaHEoH448

Situational awareness is a large part of human factors. How do you respond and reorganise your team during a critical event in surgery? Consider PPP: Patient, Procedure, People. #RCSEngRegionalReps https://t.co/eDm7D3Ri4w

.@BrennanSurgeon, @J_Hardie and Dr Steve Jarvis share how applying human factors to your practice improves patient safety. A good first step? Lowering the hierarchy gradient. Teams are empowered & at their best when everyone feels they can speak up. #RCSEngRegionalReps https://t.co/a9bVNfgmoH
